definition: just/simply/stubbornly/really
hard/stiff/strong/firm/resolutely/doggedly/good (quality)/able (person)/(of food) filling/substantial
is/are/am/yes/to be
variant of 是[shi4]/(used in given names)

sentences.english: They simply couldn't get together on matters of policy.
sentences.chinese: 他们硬是在政策问题上没有达成一致。

sentences.english: But the Queen Mother of ruthless, and finally he just break up this pair of happy couples.
sentences.chinese: 然而王母冷酷无情，最后硬是拆散了这对恩爱夫妻。

sentences.english: I wanted to stay, but she dragged me off to help her shop.
sentences.chinese: 我本想留下来，可她硬是把我拉走帮她买东西。

sentences.english: However, the Chinese government has never made sense of it.
sentences.chinese: 中国政府却硬是不懂这个道理。

sentences.english: He will have a terrible itch in his throat—itch to speak out.
sentences.chinese: 喉间硬是痒得出奇，思一吐为快。

sentences.english: For absolving Song escort department want and the scapegoat are made by him actually.
sentences.chinese: 为了开脱宋押司硬是要把他做替罪羊。

sentences.english: But it just burned muddled Zhou Qingqing YouBin up a night.
sentences.chinese: 但是被烧糊涂的周青青却硬是折腾了尤斌一个晚上。

sentences.english: After the meal, sporting a toothpick between their teeth, they will be glowing with smug satisfaction .
sentences.chinese: 他饭后衔着一根牙签，红光满面，硬是觉得可以骄人。

definition: stiff/rigid/inflexible/forcibly
with great difficulty/very difficult

(indicates that sth turns out just the opposite of what one would wish) unfortunately/as it happened/(indicates that sth is the opposite of what would be normal or reasonable) stubbornly/contrarily/against reason/(indicates that sb or a group is singled out) precisely/only/of all people
almost/nearly
to do sth by force/Taiwan pr. [qiang3 xing2]
unexpectedly/to one's surprise/go so far as to
fully/no less than/as much as/extremely
unexpectedly/to one's surprise/in spite of everything/in that crazy way/actually/to go as far as to
without any better option/to have to/to be forced to
life or death/fate/no matter what/anyway/for the life of me
if it were not for/but for
(idiomatic usage) with great difficulty/to have a hard time (convincing sb, relinquishing sth etc)/(literal usage) so easy
firmly set on doing sth/to insist on doing/determined in one's course of action
to have no alternative but to/to be obliged to
(followed by a verb phrase, then – optionally – 不可, or 不行 etc) must
to try one's very best to persuade sb (idiom)/to reason with sb in every way possible
